metadata.bijbeltekst: None explicitly cited (Thematic: Civil Rights/Martin Luther King Jr.)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The struggle for civil rights and national character in America, framed as a movement toward a 'historical destiny' of equality.

subject.identificatie: The Nation / The Civil Rights Movement (personified by MLK)
tekstueel_bewijs: What Dr. King... did was to heave the nation forward
the black American community... may well be able to bear segregation

object.identificatie: National Decency / Fulfillment of National Purpose
tekstueel_bewijs: fulfillment of its national purpose and of its historical destiny
a decency it had never known before
the great dreams of American liberation

zender.identificatie: The Hebrew-Christian Motivation / American Democratic Ideals
tekstueel_bewijs: the Hebrew-Christian motivation, which lay at the back of all that Martin King was
enabled the nation... to assert itself as a leader of the world
hope for a society of equality and opportunity
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: Martin Luther King Jr. / Decent Impulses / God (as a guarantor of the season's end)
tekstueel_bewijs: he came for many people to be the symbol and the personification
There is a God who rules above... he'll fight my battle
helper.rol_van_god: Helper (God is the one who 'fights the battle' for the human subject's cause)

tekstueel_bewijs: the depth of racism; how deeply textured it was
marriage of the religious right and political conservatism at the altar of greed
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily systemic racism and political shifts rather than an ontological or cosmic power of sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The individual believer's endurance during a 'sad time' of political retreat.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('those of you who believe')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The individual must endure (Secondary) so that the national destiny (Primary) can eventually be resumed.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Christian Motivation → National Decency → The American Public

voorbeelden_god_subject: There is a God who rules above
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we have lost touch with reality
I throw out that word to those of you

voorbeelden: sooner or later we must come out into the sunlight
unmistakable mandate in the area of the liberation of humanity
determination to enter fully into the American scene
our desire truly to be a democracy
we begin to understand who and what we were
black American community has the stamina to sustain
enabled the nation... to assert itself

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Will' (desire/determination) of the nation and the community. It is a call to regain the motivation that was lost to 'weariness'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (The Dream) to S2 (The Reality of Racism) to ~S1 (The current retreat into privatism), ending with a call to hold on until S1 returns.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through historical optimism—the 'season will pass' because God 'rules above'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Racism is described as 'deeply textured' and 'scored into the personality'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is a 'Civil Religion' address. While it mentions God, the Subject of the narrative is the Nation or the Movement. God is a Helper who supports the human struggle for justice, rather than the Subject who initiates salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: What Dr. King and those who were associated with him did was to heave the nation forward
the Hebrew-Christian motivation, which lay at the back of all that Martin King was

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: There is a God who rules above

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: MLK is presented as the personification of the movement and the standard of 'grandeur of soul'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God's righteousness breaks into human history despite the failures of both the 'right' and 'left'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Encouragement to persevere in social activism; weight of 'holding the holt' rests on the hearer.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as social progress.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative is coherent as a socio-political history but lacks a strong link to a primary soteriological program (God saving sinners).
spanning_punten: The shift from 'Christian realism about human nature' to 'faith in America' creates a theological tension.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: delivered it from its own destruction, from some of its own guilt, and enabled the nation... to assert itself

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'stamina' and 'will' are treated as human psychological/communal resources.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High regarding systemic racism, low regarding the individual's radical corruption before God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a eulogy for a movement and a call to political/ethical endurance. The actantial Subject is 'The Nation' or 'The Movement', not God.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The nation is the subject of its own deliverance.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position God as the one who judges the nation and provides the only righteousness possible.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Dr. King heaved the nation forward', use 'God used the witness of Dr. King to break the nation's pride'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the 'holder of the holt' (Subject).
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the one who is 'held' by God (Receiver).
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'holt' is held by God's hand, not the hearer's grip.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' to love enemies when the 'Vouloir' is exhausted.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (racism) is already treated with significant gravity.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon is strongest in its diagnosis of the 'Opponent'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The Secondary Program (Ethics/Endurance) has replaced the Primary Program (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Establish God's justification of the ungodly as the basis for the courage to face social injustice.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a powerful rhetorical and prophetic piece of social commentary, but it requires a stronger actantial focus on God's agency to move from a 'holy day' speech to a 'Gospel' sermon.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would praise the 'I Have a Dream' references; Greimas reveals that these references reinforce a human-centered Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would look for a text; structuralism shows that even without a text, the preacher has built a 'scripture' out of American history.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'God' only enters the narrative at the very end as a 'Helper' to the human struggle, confirming the moralistic structure.

volledige_subject_lijst: The civil rights revolution delivered the nation
appendices.notities: The sermon is highly dependent on the 'American Dream' as a narrative framework.
